title: Blocking of Viber and anime streaming websites
description: Viber was blocked for violating Russian legal requirements, along with major anime streaming websites.
detailed_description: In addition to Viber, popular anime sites such as jut.su, AnimeGO, and Yummy were also blocked. The reasons cited were non-compliance with Russian internet regulations.

title: Blocking of Discord
description: Discord was blocked due to violations of Russian legislation.
detailed_description: Russian authorities justified the blocking by stating that the platform did not comply with regulations, possibly related to content moderation or data storage policies.

title: Blocking of the fanfiction website 'Ficbook'
description: Ficbook was blocked for refusing to remove LGBT content.
detailed_description: The Russian government demanded the removal of certain LGBT-related stories, and after non-compliance, the platform was fully restricted.

title: Blocking of the imageboard 'Ychan'
description: Ychan, one of the oldest Russian imageboards, was blocked without prior warning.
detailed_description: The imageboard, popular in Russian internet culture, was suddenly taken down. No prior notices were given to users or administrators before the restriction.

title: Blocking of Metacritic
description: Metacritic was blocked without official justification.
detailed_description: The platform, known for aggregating reviews of movies, TV shows, and games, was unexpectedly blocked, with no clear reasons provided by Russian authorities.

title: Blocking of Patreon
description: Patreon was blocked at the request of the Prosecutor General's Office.
detailed_description: No official detailed explanation was provided, but the platform was known for supporting independent creators, some of whom were critical of the Russian government.

title: Blocking of Instagram
description: Instagram was blocked after changing its content moderation policy to allow hate speech against Russian military personnel.
detailed_description: The Russian government classified this policy change as extremist, leading to the platform's complete shutdown in Russia.

title: Blocking of Twitter
description: Twitter was blocked by a decision of the Prosecutor General's Office on February 24, 2022.
detailed_description: This action was part of broader efforts to control online discussions regarding Russiaâ€™s military actions. The decision led to the restriction of Twitter across Russian ISPs.

title: Blocking of Facebook
description: Facebook was blocked due to 'discrimination against Russian media and information resources' and for extremist activities.
detailed_description: The Russian authorities claimed that Facebook's policies allowed hate speech against Russian military personnel, leading to its classification as an extremist platform.

title: Blocking of 'Smart Voting' website
description: The 'Smart Voting' website was blocked due to its association with FBK, which was recognized as an extremist organization.
detailed_description: The website was used as a platform for opposition electoral strategy. Its blocking was justified by its links to FBK, an organization declared extremist by Russian authorities.
